meanings.definition: Persistently avoid, ignore, or reject (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: She kept shunning her old friend, refusing to talk to her.
meanings.sent2: The cat was shunning the new food in its bowl.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was shunning the acorns, looking for tastier treats.
meanings.sent4: The student's shunning of the difficult math problem only made it harder.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds shunning the sun created a gloomy atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The act of avoiding, ignoring, or rejecting someone or something
meanings.sent1: His shunning of social events led to loneliness.
meanings.sent2: The shunning of the stray dog by the community was heartbreaking.
meanings.sent3: The shunning of vegetables by the picky eater made meal times challenging.
meanings.sent4: The shunning of responsibility by the politician was evident to all.
meanings.sent5: The shunning of the old traditions brought about a new era of change.
